intro: Boerhavia heimerlii, commonly known as the desert bluemink, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing annual herb with small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has slender, branched stems and narrow, fleshy leaves adapted to conserve water. Its flowers are typically arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Boerhavia heimerlii is well-suited to hot, dry environments and is often found in sandy or rocky soils.
